intro: Gomphia rufidula, commonly known as the red-stemmed gomphia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in coastal dune environments. Gomphia rufidula is adapted to salt spray and sandy conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
